metadata.Title: CVE-2023-41358 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in FRRouting FRR through 9.0. bgpd/bgp_packet.c processes NLRIs if the attribute length is zero.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-41358` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

frr - 7.2.1-1ubuntu0.2+esm1
frr-pythontools - 7.2.1-1ubuntu0.2+esm1
frr-rpki-rtrlib - 7.2.1-1ubuntu0.2+esm1
frr-snmp - 7.2.1-1ubuntu0.2+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

quagga - 1.2.4-4ubuntu0.1
quagga-bgpd - 1.2.4-4ubuntu0.1
quagga-core - 1.2.4-4ubuntu0.1
quagga-isisd - 1.2.4-4ubuntu0.1
quagga-ospf6d - 1.2.4-4ubuntu0.1
quagga-ospfd - 1.2.4-4ubuntu0.1
quagga-pimd - 1.2.4-4ubuntu0.1
quagga-ripd - 1.2.4-4ubuntu0.1
quagga-ripngd - 1.2.4-4ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: sbeattie> the quagga project was renamed to frr

criterions.comment: frr package in esm-apps/focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7.2.1-1ubuntu0.2+esm1').
quagga package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.2.4-4ubuntu0.1').
